content.title: Internet Subsidy Scheme
content.details: Launched in 2018, the 'Internet Subsidy Scheme' is one of the 'Information Technology Policy Schemes' by the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa. The objective and the scope of this scheme is to provide Internet Subsidy to the eligible Information Technology Units in the State of Goa. 25% reimbursement on high-speed bandwidth, subject to a maximum of ₹ 5,00,000 per annum whichever is lower. All the New and Existing Units having their operations in Goa are eligible. The scheme has been framed as a part of Goa's IT Policy that envisages Goa as an aspirational geographical and human resource base for IT Units and a preferred destination for their investment and expansion.
benefits: 25% reimbursement on high-speed bandwidth, subject to a maximum of ₹ 5,00,000 per annum whichever is lower.
The subsidy can be availed for a period of three years from the date of commencement of operations or from the date of notification of this policy whichever is later.
eligibility: All the new and existing units must have their operations in Goa.

The applicant must be one of the below: Proprietorship Firm, Private Limited Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013 (or equivalent), Public Limited Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013 (or equivalent), Registered Partnership Firm incorporated under the Indian Partnership Act, 1932 (or equivalent), Limited Liability Partnership incorporated under the Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008 (or equivalent).
The bank accounts of the unit and/or its partner(s)/director(s) should be linked to Aadhaar.
exclusions: The units availing similar financial incentives under any other policy of the Government of Goa are not eligible for availing benefits under this scheme.
documents_required: Copy of new unit registration document/certificate
Copies of PAN, Aadhaar and GST TIN
Copy of first bill generated showing the date of commencement of operations or other relevant document
Copies of internet bills for the period for which the incentive is being claimed. Bills should clearly show the name and address of the unit
Proof of payment of the bills

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual reimbursement for high-speed bandwidth under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme allows a reimbursement of 25% on high-speed bandwidth, subject to a maximum of ₹5,00,000 per annum or whichever is lower.

faqs.question: Can you clarify the duration for which the subsidy on high-speed bandwidth can be availed?
faqs.answer: The subsidy can be availed for a period of three years from the date of commencement of operations or from the date of notification of this policy, whichever is later.

faqs.question: How does budgetary allocation impact the benefits provided by this scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits under this scheme are subject to budgetary allocation. If the allocation is exceeded, no Promissory Estoppel shall be applicable, and benefits may be discontinued.

faqs.question: How often will units be assessed for eligibility to continue receiving benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Units will be subject to evaluation at the end of each Fiscal Year to verify their eligibility to continue receiving benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for the applicant units, both new and existing, to have their operations in Goa?
faqs.answer: Yes, in order to be eligible to apply for this scheme, the New and Existing Units must have their operations in Goa.

faqs.question: Is Udyog Aadhaar a mandatory document for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant unit shall be eligible for the benefits under this scheme only upon production of Udyog Aadhaar.
